name: sensuously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that affects or relates to the physical senses, rather than pleasing the mind or the intelligence: The film is is emotionally devastating and sensuously rich. If you gaze at a painting by Monet or Titian you react sensuously to its beauty and skill.
in a way that expresses or suggests physical, especially sexual, pleasure or satisfaction: her sensuously parted lips She sighed and stretched her body sensuously. See
sensuous
More examplesFewer examplesIt's the most sensuously beautiful opera you can imagine.The master bedroom has a sensuously designed ensuite bathroom. This car is sensuously pleasing to drive.
